entries.title: add
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceadd {number} to [chunk of] {container}

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceAdds the value of number to the number in a container.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
put 2 into x
add 3 to x
answer x -- will display "5"

put "1,2,3" into x
add 3 to item 2 of x
answer x -- will display "1,5,3"

entries.title: answer
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceanswer {text}
answer {text} with {option1} or {option2} [or {option3}]

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceDisplays a dialog box.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
answer "abc" -- will display "abc"

answer "are you sure?" with "OK" or "cancel" 
-- user can choose OK or cancel
put it into whichChosen
if whichChosen is 1 then
    answer "clicked OK"
else if whichChosen is 2 then
    answer "clicked cancel"
end if

entries.title: ask
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceask {text}
ask {text} with {defaulttext}

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceDisplays a dialog box allowing the user to type in a response.
If the user clicks Cancel, the result will be an empty string "".

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
ask "what is your favorite color?" with "blue"
put it into favColor
answer ("you chose" && favColor)

entries.title: choose
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdcechoose {toolname} tool

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceUse the choose command for programmatically drawing pictures.
See the example.
Doesn't set the actual tool, which is always Browse when scripts 
are running.
See also: click, drag.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
choose "pencil" tool
click at 10,20
-- this draws a black pixel at the coordinates x=10, y=20

-- Currently supported tools include:
brush
bucket
pencil
line
rect
oval
roundrect
curve
spray

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceUse the click command for programmatically drawing pictures.

draw.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
choose "pencil" tool
click at 10,20
-- this draws a pixel at the coordinates x=10, y=20

entries.title: enable
exit
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceexit

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceExits the current function, skipping over any subsequent lines 
of code. Similar to return, but does not return a value.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
on mouseUp
    put cd fld "fld1" into x
    if x is not a number then
        answer "you did not type a number"
        exit mouseUp
    end if
    put x * 2 into cd fld "fld1"
end mouseUp

entries.title: exit repeat
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceexit repeat

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceExit the current loop.
Equivalent to "break" in C.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
repeat with x = 1 to 3
    if x == 2 then
        break
    end if
    answer x
end repeat
-- displays 1
-- and does not display 2 or 3

entries.title: get
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceget {expression}

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceEvaluates any expression and saves the result to the variable "it".

Not very useful compared with the 'put' command, but it is here
for tradition's sake.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
get 2+3
put it into x
answer x -- shows 5

get the width of cd btn "myBtn"
put it into x
answer x -- shows the width of the specified button

entries.title: global
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceglobal {variableName}

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceIndicates that a variable is a global.
1) it can be accessed from any other script
2) the contents are saved even after the function is complete.
The contents are lost when the stack is exited, however, and are not saved to disk.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
global currentData1, currentData2
put "stored 1" into currentData1
put "stored 2" into currentData2

entries.title: if/then
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceif/then

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceLike in C, if a branch can be taken, all other else branches
will be skipped, as in the third example below.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
if x > 0 then
    answer "x is greater than 0"
end if

if x > 0 then
    answer "x is greater than 0"
else
    answer "x is not greater than 0"
end if

if 3+3 is 6 then
    answer "yes"
else if 2+2 is 4 then
    answer "not run, even though it is true"
end if

if x > 50 then
    answer "x is greater than 50"
else if x > 40 then
    answer "x is greater than 40"
else
    answer "x is not greater than 40"
end if

entries.title: next repeat
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdcenext repeat

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceInside a loop, go back to the top of the loop, skipping the next 
line(s) of code. Equivalent to "continue" in C.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
repeat with x = 1 to 3
    if x == 2 then
        next repeat
    end if
    answer x
end repeat
-- displays 1
-- displays 3
-- and does not display 2

entries.title: pass
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdcepass

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceExits the current function and calls a function higher in the
message hierarchy. For example, if a button has the script
monaco_9_biuosdceon mouseUp
    answer "button handling the event"
end mouseUp
and the current card has the script
on mouseUp
    answer "card handling the event"
end mouseUptimes_12_biuosdce
and the button is clicked,
only the button's code will be run.

If you want both to be run, you can use the pass command.
If a button has the script
monaco_9_biuosdceon mouseUp
    answer "button handling the event"
    pass mouseUp
    -- any code here will be skipped
end mouseUptimes_12_biuosdce
and the current card has the script
monaco_9_biuosdceon mouseUp
    answer "card handling the event"
end mouseUptimes_12_biuosdce
and the button is clicked,
both will be run.

entries.title: put
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdceput {expression} into {container}

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceEvaluates any expression and saves the result to a variable or 
container.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
put "hello" into cd fld "message"

put 2+3 into x
answer x -- shows 5

put "aa,bb,cc" into x
put "11" into item 2 of x
answer x -- shows "aa,11,cc"

put "abc" into x
put "q" into char 2 of x
answer x -- shows "aqc"

put "appended text" after x
put "prepended text" before x

entries.title: repeat
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdcerepeat

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceUse to create a loop.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
repeat with x = 1 to 5
    answer ("x is now" & x)
end repeat

repeat with x = 5 down to 1
    answer ("x is now" & x)
end repeat

repeat 3 times
    answer "hi"
end repeat

repeat forever
    answer "this is an infinite loop"
end repeat

put 0 into counter
repeat forever
    answer "but not this"
    add 1 to counter
    if counter > 3 then
        exit repeat
    end if
end repeat

put 0 into counter
repeat until counter > 3
    add 1 to counter
end repeat

put 0 into counter
repeat while counter <= 3
    add 1 to counter
end repeat

entries.title: return
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdcereturn {expression}

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdcereturn a value from the current function.
Note: no lines of code after the return statement will be run.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
function myAddition p1, p2
    return p1 + p2
    answer "this line will never be reached"
end myAddition
on mouseUp
    put myAddition(1,2) into x
end mouseUp

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceUse the set command to change a property.

Some example properties:

monaco_9_biuosdceset the width of cd btn "myButton" to 100
set the topLeft of cd btn "myButton" to 24, 25
put the long name of btn "myButton" into x
set the textsize of char 2 to 4 of cd fld "myFld" to 18

See the "Properties" section of documentation for more.

entries.title: sort
entries.body:
times_24_biuosdcesort [lines|items|chars] of {container}
sort descending [lines|items|chars] of {container}
sort [lines|items|chars] of {container} [numeric|text|international]

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdceSort styles:
For text sorting (default), compares text, not case sensitive.
For numeric sorting, interpret as numbers, e.g. 10 sorts after 2.
For international sorting, compares text using current locale.

Examples:
monaco_9_biuosdce
put "aa,cc,bb" into x
sort items of x
answer x -- displays "aa,bb,cc"

times_24_biuosdcewait {number} [seconds|milliseconds|ms|ticks]

times_12_biuosdcetimes_12_biuosdcePauses the script.

navigation palette, or by changing to the button or field tool.)
